parts.text:
<OUTPUT_TEXT>
As an elementary school teacher, enforcing administration policies and rules is fundamental to creating a safe, respectful, and productive learning environment for all students. My approach is built on clear communication, consistency, and positive reinforcement.

At the beginning of the year, I dedicate time to explicitly teach and discuss our school's policies – from hallway expectations and playground rules to dress code and technology use – ensuring students understand the 'why' behind them using age-appropriate language and examples. We often role-play scenarios to solidify understanding.

Throughout the day, I consistently model expected behaviors and provide frequent, specific praise for students who follow the rules. When a rule is not followed, I address it promptly and calmly, using redirection and logical, age-appropriate consequences as outlined in our school's discipline matrix. I ensure fairness and consistency in application across all students, fostering a sense of predictability and trust.

For persistent issues or more serious infractions, I maintain clear documentation, communicate proactively with parents to partner in addressing the behavior, and collaborate closely with administration to ensure appropriate support and follow-through, always aiming to guide students toward responsible choices and uphold our school's positive culture.
</OUTPUT_TEXT>
